intro: Chordospartium stevensonii, commonly known as Stevenson's sea holly, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime climates. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
